backupxConfigTable.name: backupxConfigTable
backupxConfigTable.description: A table of Backup Services configuration information.

backupxConfigEntry.name: backupxConfigEntry
backupxConfigEntry.description: An entry in the Backup Service Entity Configuration table, containing information about a backup service.

backupxConfigID.name: backupxConfigID
backupxConfigID.description: The Backup Service ID. This is used as a unique ID to identify a backup service entity.

backupxConfigDescription.name: backupxConfigDescription
backupxConfigDescription.description: A description for this Backup Service.

backupxConfigAdminStatus.name: backupxConfigAdminStatus
backupxConfigAdminStatus.description: This object controls the Administrative Status of this Backup Service. Enabled will allow the Backup Service to operate. Disabled will disable the service without deleting it. Delete will disable the backup and delete the backup service configuration record.

backupxConfigPrimaryType.name: backupxConfigPrimaryType
backupxConfigPrimaryType.description: This object controls the type of entity to be backed up in case of failure.

backupxConfigPrimaryIndex1.name: backupxConfigPrimaryIndex1
backupxConfigPrimaryIndex1.description: This object controls the first Index object to use to identify the Primary entity to backup based on type: Physical Port: slot Frame Relay PVC: slot

backupxConfigPrimaryIndex2.name: backupxConfigPrimaryIndex2
backupxConfigPrimaryIndex2.description: This object controls the first Index object to use to identify the Primary entity to backup based on type: Physical Port: port Frame Relay PVC: port

backupxConfigPrimaryIndex3.name: backupxConfigPrimaryIndex3
backupxConfigPrimaryIndex3.description: This object controls the first Index object to use to identify the Primary entity to backup based on type: Physical Port: 0 Frame Relay PVC: DLCI number

backupxConfigBackupType.name: backupxConfigBackupType
backupxConfigBackupType.description: This object controls the type of entity to use to back up the primary entity in case of failure.

backupxConfigBackupIndex1.name: backupxConfigBackupIndex1
backupxConfigBackupIndex1.description: This object controls the first Index object to use to identify the backup entity based on type: PPP Peer: Peer ID

backupxConfigBackupIndex2.name: backupxConfigBackupIndex2
backupxConfigBackupIndex2.description: This object controls the second Index object to use to identify the backup entity: This object is currently reserved for possible future use.

backupxConfigBackupIndex3.name: backupxConfigBackupIndex3
backupxConfigBackupIndex3.description: This object controls the third Index object to use to identify the backup entity: This object is currently reserved for possible future use.

backupxConfigStartupTimeout.name: backupxConfigStartupTimeout
backupxConfigStartupTimeout.description: This object controls the time in seconds after system startup to wait for the Primary entity to come up before activating the backup entity.

backupxConfigActivateTimeout.name: backupxConfigActivateTimeout
backupxConfigActivateTimeout.description: This object controls the time in seconds after the Primary entity enters and stays in a Failed state before activating the backup entity.

backupxConfigRestoreTimeout.name: backupxConfigRestoreTimeout
backupxConfigRestoreTimeout.description: This object controls the time in seconds after the Primary entity enters and stays in a Operational state before deactivating the backup entity.
